text.__SUMMARY__: Auristomia barashi is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Pyramidellidae, the pyrams and their allies.
text.Description: The shell grows to a length of 2 mm.
text.Distribution:
This species occurs in the following locations:
Mersin Bay (Turkey)
Eastern Mediterranean
text.References: Giannuzzi-Savelli R., Pusateri F., Micali, P., Nofroni, I., Bartolini S. (2014). Atlante delle conchiglie marine del Mediterraneo, vol. 5 (Heterobranchia). Edizioni Danaus, Palermo, pp. 1– 111 with 41 unnumbered plates (figs. 1-363), appendix pp. 1–91.page(s): 54, appendix p. 13, 60
